panels.description: This is the entire latency till the transaction finishes i.e journal write + transaction time. It will do a buffer write here.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(first("apply_latency.sum"), 1s)/non_negative_derivative(first("apply_latency.avgcount"),1s)   FROM "ceph" WHERE "host" =~  /^([[host]])$/  AND "id" =~ /^([[osd]])$/ AND  $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", "id" fill(previous)

panels.title: FileStore Apply Latency osd-$osd

targets.query: SELECT NON_NEGATIVE_DERIVATIVE(last("ops"),1s)  FROM "ceph" WHERE "host" =~  /^([[host]])$/  AND "id" =~ /^([[osd]])$/ AND  $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", "id"  fill(previous)

panels.description: defined by getloadavg() / number of onlinecpus

targets.query: SELECT NON_NEGATIVE_DERIVATIVE(last("loadavg"),1s) FROM "ceph" WHERE "host" =~ /^([[host]])$/  AND "id" =~ /^([[osd]])$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", "id"  fill(previous)

panels.title: CPU OSDs Load AVG

panels.description: Latency of client operations (including queue time)

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(first("op_latency.sum"), 1s)/non_negative_derivative(first("op_latency.avgcount"),1s)   FROM "ceph" WHERE "host" =~  /^([[host]])$/  AND "id" =~ /^([[osd]])$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", "id" fill(previous)

panels.title: Op Client Latency osd-$osd (With Queue time)

panels.description: Tempo Gasto para sair do Journal apÃ³s os 15 segundos configurados e ir para disco  sata efetivamente

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(first("commitcycle_latency.sum"), 1s)/non_negative_derivative(first("commitcycle_latency.avgcount"),1s)   FROM "ceph" WHERE "host" =~  /^([[host]])$/  AND "id" =~ /^([[osd]])$/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", "id" fill(previous)

panels.title: Commit cycle Latency osd-$osd (Flush for disk)

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(first("commitcycle_interval.sum"), 1s)/non_negative_derivative(first("commitcycle_interval.avgcount"),1s)   FROM "ceph" WHERE "host" =~  /^([[host]])$/  AND "id" =~ /^([[osd]])$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", "id" fill(previous)

panels.description: This is the latency of putting the ops in journal. Write is acknowledged after that (well a bit after that, there is one context switch after this).

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(first("journal_latency.sum"), 1s)/non_negative_derivative(first("journal_latency.avgcount"),1s)   FROM "ceph" WHERE "host" =~ /^([[host]])$/  AND "id" =~ /^([[osd]])$/ AND  $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", "id" fill(previous)

panels.title: Latency Journal osd-$osd (return write Ack for client)

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(first("journal_wr"), 1s)   FROM "ceph" WHERE "host" =~ /^([[host]])$/  AND "id" =~ /^([[osd]])$/   AND  $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", "id" fill(previous)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("journal_wr_bytes.sum"), 1s)/non_negative_derivative(last("journal_wr_bytes.avgcount"), 1s)   FROM "ceph" WHERE "host" =~  /^([[host]])$/  AND "id" =~ /^([[osd]])$/ AND  $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", "id" fill(previous)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(first("journal_queue_ops"), 1s)   FROM "ceph" WHERE "host" =~  /^([[host]])$/  AND "id" =~ /^([[osd]])$/ AND  $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", "id" fill(previous)

panels.description:
This is the latency of putting the op in the journal queue. This will give you an idea how much throttling is going on at the first place. This depends on the following two parameters if you are using XFS. filestore_queue_max_ops
filestore_queue_max_bytes

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(first("queue_transaction_latency_avg.sum"), 1s)/non_negative_derivative(first("queue_transaction_latency_avg.avgcount"),1s)   FROM "ceph" WHERE "host" =~ /^([[host]])$/  AND "id" =~ /^([[osd]])$/ AND  $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", "id" fill(previous)

panels.title: queue_transaction_latency_avg  osd-$osd

panels.title: All Average time of mutex in locked state

list.name: host
list.query: show tag values from ceph with key = host
list.tagValuesQuery: SHOW TAG VALUES WITH KEY = "host" WHERE tags =~ /$tag/
list.tagsQuery: SHOW TAG VALUES WITH KEY = "tags" where role = 'osd_storage'

list.name: osd
list.query: show tag values from ceph with key = id  where  "host" =~ /^[[host]]$/
list.tagValuesQuery: SHOW TAG VALUES WITH KEY = "host" WHERE tags =~ /$tag/

title: Telegraf Ceph - Latency
description:
telegraf ceph with influxdb
Suggestions for improvements are welcome:
www.brunocarvalho.net
